intro: Sida asterocalyx, commonly known as the star-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features small, five-petaled flowers that are typically pale to dark purple in color. Its leaves are ovate with a distinctive star-shaped pattern on the underside. Sida asterocalyx is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, sunny environments.
